explanation: The original second line used int(x/y)+1. Converting the float division to int then adding 1 is an incorrect way to compute the ceiling of x/y because when x is exactly divisible by y this produces a result one too large (and float->int truncation can behave incorrectly for negatives). I replaced that line with the integer-ceiling expression (x + y - 1) // y which correctly computes ceil(x/y) for positive integers using only integer arithmetic.
fixed_code:
x, y = map(int, input().split())
print((x + y - 1)//y)
